Paralysis

Paralysis is a status effect in Remixed Dungeon that prevents a character from taking any actions for a period of time.

Description

When a character is paralyzed, they are completely immobilized and unable to perform any actions until the effect wears off or is cured. This includes movement, attacking, using items, or casting spells.

Effects

  • Action Prevention: Paralyzed characters cannot take any actions
  • Duration: Standard duration is 10 turns, modified by resistance effects
  • Vulnerability: Paralyzed targets are vulnerable to attacks
  • Automatic Recovery: Effect ends automatically after time expires
  • Break Chance: Paralyzed characters have a chance to break free when taking damage (chance based on damage dealt vs current HP)
  • Visual Indicator: Paralyzed characters display a specific status animation

Causes

  • Potion of Paralytic Gas - Thrown potion that creates a gas cloud causing paralysis
  • Paralysis Arrow - Thrown missile that applies 4 turns of paralysis (uses Stun effect)
  • Paralysis Enchantment - Weapon enchantment that has a chance to apply Stun on hit (similar to paralysis)
  • Curare Dart - Thrown dart that applies Paralysis effect
  • Paralytic Gas - Gas effect from the gas blob
  • Certain enemy attacks - Some creatures can paralyze with their attacks
  • Special spells - Some spells may cause paralysis

Immunities

  • Fetid Rat - Immune to paralysis
  • Pasty-Mimic - Immune to paralysis, toxic gas, and stun
  • Lich - Immune to paralysis
  • Undead creatures - Often have resistance or immunity
  • Piranha - Immune to paralysis
  • King - Immune to paralysis
  • Warrior's Class Armor - Can apply paralysis to enemies
  • Resistance from Ring of Elements may reduce duration

Strategy

  • For Players: Use paralytic effects to gain tactical advantages
  • Defensively: Try to avoid being paralyzed in dangerous situations
  • Offensively: Paralyze powerful enemies to gain breathing room
  • Timing: Consider the duration when planning your next actions
  • Damage Breaking: If paralyzed, taking damage might help break free (chance based on damage dealt vs HP)

Countermeasures

  • Potions of cure poison do NOT cure paralysis (different effect)
  • Ring of Elements may provide resistance to reduce duration
  • Avoiding paralytic attacks or items when possible
  • Taking damage may occasionally break the effect

Technical Details

  • Java Class: com.watabou.pixeldungeon.actors.buffs.Paralysis
  • Default Duration: 10 turns (DURATION constant)
  • Visual State: CharSprite.State.PARALYSED
  • Breaking Mechanism: Chance to break when damage dealt >= Random.Int(damage) vs Random.Int(target.hp())
  • Enchantment Class: com.watabou.pixeldungeon.items.weapon.enchantments.Paralysis
  • Arrow Class: com.watabou.pixeldungeon.items.weapon.missiles.ParalysisArrow
  • Stun Class: com.watabou.pixeldungeon.actors.buffs.Stun (used by Paralysis enchantment and Paralysis Arrow)

Content Verification

  • Information source: Java Classes com.watabou.pixeldungeon.actors.buffs.Paralysis, com.watabou.pixeldungeon.items.weapon.enchantments.Paralysis, com.watabou.pixeldungeon.items.weapon.missiles.ParalysisArrow, com.watabou.pixeldungeon.actors.buffs.Stun

  • Effect descriptions: Based on in-game mechanics and string resources
  • Source code: Paralysis.java

Related

  • Potion of Paralytic Gas - Creates ParalyticGas blob that applies paralysis
  • Paralysis Arrow - Missile weapon that causes paralysis
  • Paralysis Enchantment - Weapon enchantment that causes stun
  • Stun - Related status effect (Paralysis enchantment and Paralysis Arrow use Stun class)

  • Buffs and Debuffs - Other temporary status effects
  • Status Effects - Other condition types
  • Curare Dart - Another item that causes paralysis
